intro: Tithymalus silenifolius, commonly known as the silenifolius tithymalus, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
